scenarioDescription:
The K2-125 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-125 is a star with 0.49 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.4 times its radius. It is located 404.94 light years away from the solar system.

K2-125 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-125 system


K2-125 b

K2-125 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-125 b is 5.406 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-125 b is 2.180 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-125 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-125, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-125 - System With 1 Exoplanet
